RacismRacism is the perception that people are not all equal to each other, but are divided into upper and lower, distinguished by either skin color, ethnicity, religion, gender, or sexual orientation etc. The most common type of racism , and what has given the original name in the word, Italian. So, we see that the phenomenon of racism does not stop in the paleolithic cultures, but it extends throughout history as well as in modern times. GlobalizationGlobalization or internationalization is the autonomy of all the parameters (economy, communication, etc.) that until recently (a few decades) sought to have borders within a state-patron. Parameters that tend to be liberalized and diffused, following globalization, are trade, social structure, technology, culture, political system, knowledge, etc. The term is often used in the argumentation of the need for a new universal hegemony in the people. The term has been used since at least 1944 and the first to use it in economic terms was Theodore Levitt. Definition A typical, though restrictive, definition is given by the International Monetary Fund, which emphasizes the growing economic interdependence of countries worldwide through the increasing volume and variety of international transactions in goods and services, the free flow of capital internationally, and the rapid and widespread diffusion of technology. Although globalization is a very complex cluster of phenomena and relationships, however, one can separate its various aspects: industrial globalization - the strengthening and expansion of multinational companiesfinancial globalization - the emergence of global financial markets and easier access to external financing for corporate and state borrowerspolitical globalization - the expansion of political interests in regions and countries that are not close to the politically powerful statesglobalization of information - increasing the flow of information between geographically distant regionscultural globalization - developing intercultural contacts and creating a global culture.According to Ismail Sharif, globalization is the global process of homogenizing prices, products, earnings, interest, and profits. The development of globalization lies in three factors: the role of human migration, international trade, and the rapid movement of capital and the integration of financial markets.
